headline: Man Utd's dream XI on first day of season with Bryan Mbeumo among 15 transfers
body: Manchester United have kicked off a summer of heavy spending - but their job is far from done. Ruben Amorim is targeting a major overhaul at Old Trafford following a miserable season last time out.
As a result, the club’s finances took a huge hit, with some believing funds for the summer would be limited. But United have tried to not let that affect them.

They have already splashed £62.5m on former Wolves forward and Brazilian international Matheus Cunha. It is hoped that he could be the first attacking addition of the summer as Amorim attempts to solve his side’s goalscoring woes.
And United already have their eyes on a few more. With that being said, take a look at what the starting XI could look like against Arsenal on the opening day of next season:

Let’s start in the obvious place - in goal. There could potentially be a change ahead of next season. Andre Onana has failed to convince since his arrival from Inter Milan, with Monaco eyeing a swoop for the Cameroonian.

And should he be allowed to leave, United could move for Paris Saint-Germain star Gianluigi Donnarumma, who sees his contract expire in a year. He has already reportedly been discussing a move to the Premier League with his Italian colleagues.

While United committed to a significant outlay last term in signing Leny Yoro and Matthijs de Ligt to bolster their defence, there could yet be more signings. Youngster Diego Leon is on the way, while it has been reported that Sporting Lisbon star Ousmane Diomande is keen on being reunited with Amorim at Old Trafford.
Who else should Man United sign this summer? Share your suggestions in the comments below

And United could potentially do with another defender following the exits of Jonny Evans and Victor Lindelof. Should Diomande be signed, he could potentially replace Lisandro Martinez in the heart of the defence, with the Argentine expected to be sidelined until September. Patrick Dorgu should retain his position at left wing-back, but it'll be interesting to see if its Diogo Dalot or Amad on the right moving forwards.

Moving into midfield, the Red Devils’ line-up seems pretty well set. Last summer’s signing Manuel Ugarte should do enough to usurp Casemiro, while captain Bruno Fernandes is a near guarantee to start after spurning interest from Saudi Arabia. Given Christian Eriksen has departed, another signing in midfield might be useful but not crucial.

It’s really in attack where United will go through a real transformation. A number of forwards are already on the chopping block with loanees Antony, Jadon Sancho and Marcus Rashford all expected to leave permanently. They could be joined by Alejandro Garnacho and Rasmus Hojlund, who have both been linked with moves to Italy.

Of course, a deal for Matheus Cunha is already over the line and he could soon be followed by Bryan Mbeumo. The Brentford star is United’s next attacking target and he is already keen on a move to Old Trafford despite late competition from Tottenham.

And then leading the line could potentially be current Chelsea forward Christopher Nkunku. Reports have suggested that United are already in talks regarding a potential deal and he could potentially slot straight into the side should a deal progress.
Potential Man United XI: Donnarumma; De Ligt, Maguire, Yoro; Mazraoui, Ugarte, Fernandes, Dorgu; Mbeumo, Nkunku, Cunha.
Sky will show at least 215 live Premier League games next season, an increase of up to 100 more.

headline: LUCKHURST: Manchester United have made a change with Matheus Cunha and Bryan Mbeumo deals
body: It was noticeable during Omar Berrada's first summer as Manchester United chief executive that the club never broke the £60million barrier for a signing.

For years, Berrada's former employers at Manchester City privately bragged that they seldom spent more than £60m on a player. Jose Mourinho felt he was on a hiding to nothing against a state-backed club but it was a matter of quality more than quantity with City.

To date, City have spent in excess of that figure on only four players: Rodri, Ruben Dias, Jack Grealish and Josko Gvardiol. Grealish is the sole failure and his best season still coincided with City's treble triumph.
Leny Yoro was United's most expensive acquisition last year for an up front fee of £52.18m. The deal could total £58.91m.

Already this summer, United have crept above the £60m mark for Matheus Cunha, who had a reasonable release clause of £62.5m. Bryan Mbeumo, who outscored Cunha and everyone else in the Premier League bar Erling Haaland, Alexander Isak and Mohamed Salah, could fetch an identical fee.

That is the going rate for a Premier League-standard forward. Only one of United's five arrivals last year was an attacker and Joshua Zirkzee also had a release clause. He was based in Italy, whose league has been in decline for nearly two decades and has become a dumping ground for English clubs. Ie. not United material but nearly as economical as Jasprit Bumrah's bowling.

Sensibly, United have sought forwards with Premier League pedigree this year. Liam Delap was another they wanted on board and the eventual identity of their new No.9 (to consider Cunha or Mbeumo as one would be a complete cop-out) will be curious as it is unlikely to be a domestic deal.

Before he purged his Twitter account, Berrada revelled in how much United had overpaid for Angel di Maria in 2014. Di Maria, a reigning Champions League winner who had recently helped Argentina to reach the World Cup final, commanded a British-record £59.7m fee.

The problem with Di Maria was not the fee but the fact that he did not want to move to Manchester. United had a free run as Paris Saint-Germain, Di Maria's preferred choice, were out of the running due to financial fair play issues.
Di Maria effectively covered the cost of James Rodriguez, Madrid's vanity signing. They still had change to get Toni Kroos, possibly the bargain of the decade, at £20m.

Ed Woodward had also incepted the United tax by signing Marouane Fellaini for £4.5m more than was necessary in 2013. Back when FFP was not an issue for United and profitability and sustainability rules had not entered the football lexicon, Woodward operated as though spending inflated fees was a sound strategy. Luke Shaw became football's most expensive teenager two months before Di Maria was driven through the barriers at Carrington.

Erik ten Hag aimed high in the Premier League market and the price was not right for United. They were not in the running when Declan Rice was available in 2023, having already earmarked Mason Mount as their central midfield target, and refused to test the waters with Tottenham for Harry Kane.

Those two England internationals cost £187m combined when they moved to Arsenal and Bayern Munich. The negotiations of those deals involved 'big six' clubs, whereas Cunha and Mbeumo are more affordable, having operated outside of the elite, and are not England internationals.

Brentford were looking for between £50m and £60m for Ivan Toney last year until it transpired that no Premier League clubs would meet them at the table. That drove his price down to £40m for Al Ahli. Mbeumo, in contrast, generated interest from Tottenham Hotspur and Newcastle United and outperformed any of Toney's top-flight campaigns before he decided on United. So he was never going to be as cheap.

£60m is a figure that came to define United's 2023 summer window, one of their worst. Everyone at the club maintained that was the maximum they would pay for Rasmus Hojlund. Eventually, they overpaid with a final package of £72m.

On the eve of the 2024 window, Berrada warned United would be on a "slippery slope" if they overpaid clubs, players and agents. Their spending was more disciplined, even if it eventually totalled £206m, but this year it is needs must after United's worst season in 51 years. A little more than £120m for two of the best forwards in the Premier League last season is a statement.

United have made savings through their existence outside of the Champions League. For the third season out of four, players will be on a reduced salary due to their failure to qualify for the competition again.

Two rounds of redundancies and slashing the non-playing workforce by roughly a third have also freed up funds after a decrease of £20m year-on-year on employee benefit expenses. United's net cash inflow of £22.3m during the last quarter was an increase of £7.2m from the same quarter last year.

Sir Jim Ratcliffe's remark that United could have gone "bust" by Christmas always sounded like scaremongering. PSR has genuinely compromised them (they loaned in Wout Weghorst as Cristiano Ronaldo's mid-season replacement when Cody Gakpo was available), only it was undermined by squandering £625.43m under Ten Hag.
United's market movement under Berrada has been hitherto inoffensive but the greater the price, the greater the scrutiny. And United are now going north of £60m.

headline: LUCKHURST: Onana stance on United future amid Monaco transfer links
body: Andre Onana remains intent on staying at Manchester United and will only consider leaving if the club want to sell him.
Onana has been preparing under the assumption he will still be at United next season and coach Ruben Amorim wants to keep the 29-year-old.
Monaco have been linked with a move for Onana after they qualified for the Champions League by finishing third in Ligue 1 last season.
United have not budgeted to recruit a new No.1 amid their focus on enhancing their attack and staff at the club have offered private backing for Onana.

Onana has failed to live up this game-changing billing since he moved to United from Inter Milan for £47.2million in July 2023. He committed costly errors in the Premier League defeats to Nottingham Forest, Wolves and Brighton last season before he was culpable for both of Lyon's goals in United's 2-2 Europa League quarter-final first leg draw in April.

On the eve of that game, the Lyon midfielder Nemanja Matic dubbed Onana "one of the worst goalkeepers in the history of Man United" after the Cameroonian claimed United were "way better" than Lyon. Amorim rested Onana for United's next match away to Newcastle United.
Onana is under contract at United until 2028 and the club would require a fee of £28.32million to sell him without making a loss under the Premier League's profitability and sustainability rules.
Onana's switch to the LIAN Sports Group agency earlier this year was not with a view to a summer transfer.
He has played 101 times for United and kept 24 clean sheets.

headline: LUCKHURST: Manchester United stance on Christopher Nkunku amid Chelsea interest in Alejandro Garnacho
body: Christopher Nkunku is not one of Manchester United's prime targets for the centre forward role amid Chelsea's interest in Alejandro Garnacho.
Chelsea considered bidding for Garnacho in the winter transfer window when a potential swap deal involving Nkunku was first floated with United in the market for a forward.

Sources believe Chelsea are again attempting to create a market for Garnacho, who is set to leave after five years in Manchester. United did not move for Nkunku in the mid-season window as they refused to settle for a short-term fix.
With Garnacho now free to leave after crossing United coach Ruben Amorim, Chelsea have raised the possibility of a swap again but United have other players under consideration ahead of Nkunku.
United have submitted an improved offer in excess of £60million for Brentford winger Bryan Mbeumo and are intent on recruiting a striker after Liam Delap opted to join Chelsea.
Sporting striker Viktor Gyokeres and Hugo Ekitike of Eintracht Frankfurt are two frontmen under consideration by United, who want to jettison up to five forwards.
Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho and Antony are available for transfer after heading out on loan last season while Inter Milan have also enquired about Rasmus Hojlund.

Nkunku, 27, is not an out-and-out striker and started 22 games for Chelsea last season, with only nine coming in the Premier League. He also lost his place in the France squad this year and has not played in more than two months due to injury.
Garnacho's representatives, Carlos Cambeiro and Enrique de Lucas, attended a Chelsea match in January as the Europa Conference League winners weighed up making an offer for the winger.
De Lucas played for Chelsea in 2002-03.

headline: LUCKHURST: Bryan Mbeumo relative encouraging Manchester United amid second bid
body: Manchester United have submitted a second offer in excess of £60million for Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo.
United had an opening offer totalling £55m rejected earlier this month but have remained confident of concluding a deal for the 26-year-old.
Mbeumo wants to join United, despite firm interest from Tottenham Hotspur since they appointed his former Brentford coach Thomas Frank as Ange Postecoglou's replacement.

United goalkeeper Andre Onana has lobbied his international teammate to move to Manchester and one of Mbeumo's close relatives is also a United fan, which is believed to have further emboldened United.
Mbeumo scored 20 goals in 38 Premier League appearances last season and is out of contract next year, though Brentford have the option of a one-year extension.

United have identified Mbeumo as an ideal option to enhance their right-hand side. The club previously held discussions with the left-footed Sporting winger Geovany Quenda before he chose to join Chelsea.
Having not broken the £60m barrier for any of their five summer signings last year, United have already bought Matheus Cunha for £62.5m from Wolves and are prepared to pay a similar fee for Mbeumo.
Cunha scored 15 league goals last term and his release clause made it inevitable that Brentford would hold out for a similar fee.
United want to sign another forward, with Mbeumo regarded as more of a multi-functional option. The club intend to sign a new starting striker.
United players return for pre-season training on July 7 and the squad fly out to Chicago for their three-match pre-season tour of the United States on July 22.

headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Agreement 'reached', Bryan Mbeumo bid, Diogo Costa move
body: The Reds enjoyed a great start to the summer transfer window by wrapping up a deal for Matheus Cunha, but there is still a lot of work to be done before the new season gets underway. United are working hard behind the scenes, with the priority now said to be a new striker.

Bryan Mbeumo has emerged as a key target, with the Brentford star reportedly weighing up offers from Old Trafford and the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. Meanwhile, Andrea Onana faces an uncertain future at United.

Emiliano Martinez has been mooted as a possible replacement for the 29-year-old shot-stopper, who's attracted interest from Monaco. Jadon Sancho, Marcus Rashford and Alejandro Garnacho could also be on the move this summer as part of a comprehensive rebuild.

The former Borussia Dortmund star, who spent last season on loan at Chelsea, could help United get their hands on a couple of new faces. Sancho has reportedly turned heads in the Serie A, so a swap deal could be on the cards.
Man United and Everton are showing interest in signing Leicester City midfielder Wilfred Ndidi.
According to Alex Crook of talkSPORT, Ndidi is attracting suitors with his £9m release clause at Leicester becoming active following their relegation.
Ben Jacobs also reported that United see Ndidi as a low-cost option is Casemiro leaves this summer.
The news regarding Jadon Sancho continues with CaughtOffside reporting that Arsenal have made an enquiry to sign the winger this summer.
It's claimed that the Gunners, who want to sign a winger this window, enquired about potentially signing Sancho but they are not yet to follow up with their contact.
MEN Sport also understands that Inter Milan have enquired about Rasmus Hojlund.
Reports in Italy have claimed that the Serie A side must sort the future of Mehdi Taremi out before they make a move for the United star.
As talks with Fenerbahce continue for Jadon Sancho, Marco Giordano has reported that Juventus plan to meet Jadon Sancho's agent in the next few hours in an attempt to finalise a move.
The Italian journalist has claimed that United are willing to accept £21m for the winger.

Chelsea are currently the favourites to sign Alejandro Garnacho this summer, according to bet365. The United winger faces an uncertain future at Old Trafford, having fallen out of favour under Ruben Amorim.

Garnacho was linked with the west Londoners in the January transfer window, and he's recently emerged as a target for Bayer Leverkusen following Erik ten Hag's appointment. The latest odds on the Argentina international's club next season are as follows:
18+ only. Please gamble responsibly. Begambleaware.org.
Despite reports elsewhere, MEN Sport understands that Christopher Nkunku is not one of United's prime targets for the centre-forward.
Chelsea are said to have raised the possibility of a swap deal to sign Alejandro Garnacho but United have other players under consideration.
Hello Man United fans and good afternoon!
My name is Josh Holland and I'll be guiding you through the next few hours with all things Manchester United. First, let's give you an update on Christopher Nkunku...
Chelsea considered submitting a bid for Alejandro Garnacho during the January transfer window when a potential swap deal, involving Nkunku, was first floated.
It's understood that, with Garnacho free to leave after falling out with Ruben Amorim, the Blues have raised the possibility of an exchange again. But, United have other players under consideration.
Jadon Sancho has reached an agreement on personal terms with Fenerbahce, according to reports in Turkey.

Outlet Sabah Spor have claimed that the winger has accepted a contract offer worth around £8.5million per year. That report has been followed by journalist Orazio Accomand suggesting an offer of €18m (£15.3m) has been put to United.

Porto's exit from the Club World Cup has been compounded with reports in Portugal in the aftermath suggesting that Diogo Costa 'believes it is time to embrace a new challenge' after achieving all he can with the club.
A Bola have claimed the goalkeeper wants to move to a bigger league with United and Manchester City two teams described as being 'very interested'.

Costa is understood to have a €75million (£63.9m) release clause but Porto could accept around €60m (£51.1m), a fee which is similar to the one United have paid for Matheus Cunha and are about to pay for Bryan Mbeumo.
Ever since he broke into the first team, Alejandro Garnacho has never been far away from the headlines.
His talent is undeniable, but he's crossed United managers far too many times and that is a big reason why Ruben Amorim is prepared to offload the Argentina international this summer.
Sunday evening proved to be another one of those occasions as he posted on Instagram wearing an Aston Villa jersey donning the name of fellow United exile Marcus Rashford on the back of it.
It was a deliberate ploy to garner a reaction from fans online and, if anything, has proven why Amorim is right to want to get rid of the 20-year-old this summer.
His talented, though, is undoubted and there will be plenty of suitors for him and United should be able to bank a healthy fee by selling him.
With that in mind, here is a look at the current state of play.

Few players have divided opinion at United in recent years as much as Scott McTominay did. But after he had plundered a respectable tally of ten goals during the 2023/24 campaign, United were left with an important decision to make.
He had just one year remaining on his contract campaign and it meant United had to decide whether to cash-in or attempt to tie him down to a new deal.
After scoring 13 goals and helping Napoli win a second Serie A title in three seasons in his debut season in Italy, United's decision to sell the Scotsman has naturally been called into question.
Taking his contract situation, the landscape of United's midfield options and the financial package on offer, United were right to sell McTominay when they did...
Read the full story here.

According to Fabrizio Romano and Portuguese outlet A Bola, Viktor Gyokeres has told the Sporting president that he wants to leave this summer. The 27-year-old striker has been heavily linked with a move to the Premier League for a while now following his impressive performances in the Portuguese top-flight.

The report claims Gyokeres has no intention of playing for the club anymore as he wants to start a new chapter. Romano reckons that the Sweden international 'feels heartbroken', and he's not expected to return to training.

According to Saudi outlet Sport Jazirah, Al-Nassr are close to signing Casemiro. The report claims that negotiations are at an 'advanced stage' as the 33-year-old closes in on a move to the Saudi Pro League.

United forked out £70m to sign Casemiro from Real Madrid in August 2022. The Reds reportedly require need to recuperate £15m to avoid registering a loss, according to the Profit and Sustainability Rules.

According to Caughtoffside, United have shortlisted Marco Carnesecchi as a potential replacement for Andre Onana. The report claims that Atalanta don't want to sell their 24-year-old goalkeeper, although an offer close to €50m (£42m) could make the Serie A outfit change their mind.

It's said that United and Atalanta have an excellent relationship following previous dealings for Amad Diallo and Rasmus Hojlund. Caughtoffside adds that the Reds are also keen on Emiliano Martinez from Aston Villa.

Enzo Maresca hinted that Christopher Nkunku could stay at Chelsea this summer despite facing an uncertain future at Stamford Bridge. The former RB Leipzig forward has recently been linked with a move to United as Ruben Amorim looks to bolster his frontline.
Speaking to reporters ahead of the Blues' final Club World Cup group stage game against ES Tunis, Maresca declared: "Christo is with us. He's our player.
"He's doing very well in the last four, five days. For sure, tomorrow we are going to do rotation. We'll see if there is any chance for the ones that are not playing a lot."

According to Italian outlet Gazzetta dello Sport, Juventus are willing to offer players to United in a bid to finalise a deal for Jadon Sancho. The report claims that the 25-year-old winger's agents have never broken contact with the Italian giants, who tried to sign him on loan in January 2024.

It's said that United want to offload Sancho, so they're open-minded to proposals in talks; meanwhile, Juventus plan to offer a 'prominent role' in the squad. Gazzetta dello Sport have named Dusan Vlahovic as a potential makeweight.

The 25-year-old striker, who sees his contract in Turin expire next year, has previously been linked with a move to the Premir League. Vlahovic has reportedly been 'unreceptive' to offers to leave the club, snubbing offers from Saudi Arabia and Turkey.
Gazzetta dello Sport reckon that Douglas Luiz could be an option too...

According to French outlet L’Equipe, United have made contact with Christopher Nkunku's entourage ahead of a potential transfer to Old Trafford. The report claims the two parties discussed terms of a possible deal, but no offer was made.
It's said that Ruben Amorim is keen to sign at least two forwards this summer. L’Equipe reckon that Nkunku wants to leave Chelsea, and he's attracted interest from several clubs.
That said, no concrete negotiations have taken place yet, and it remains to be seen whether United will pursue his signature.
It's understood that Mbeumo wants to join United, despite firm interest from Tottenham Hotspur since they poached Thomas Frank from the G-Tech Community Staduium.
Andre Onana has lobbied his international teammate to join, and one of his close relatives is also a supporter, which is believed to have further emboldened the Reds.
Ruben Amorim's side enjoyed a great start to the summer transfer window by wrapping up a deal for Matheus Cunha, but there is still a lot of work to be done before the new season gets underway...
A very hectic afternoon/evening comes to an end. We've had a new Bryan Mbeumo bid, a report of a Casemiro exit and a possible swap deal involving Christopher Nkunku and Alejandro Garnacho.
Tune in tomorrow as we react to tonight's news and bring you the fall out including all the very latest.
Man United are increasingly considering turning their to Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins, Fichajes [via the Evening Standard] have claimed

A new striker remains on their radar after Liam Delap opted to join Chelsea and Viktor Gyokeres continues to be tipped with a move to Arsenal. Watkins is said to be an 'appealing candidate' for United now.
Villa want around £60m for the England international and need to raise funds this summer to ease their PSR concerns.
AS Monaco have made 'concrete contact' with Torino goalkeeper and Man United target Vanja Milinković-Savić.
According to Santi Aouna, the Ligue 1 side are keen on triggering his €20m release clause. United's Andre Onana has also been linked with a move to France.
The updates are coming at us tonight and here's one that could develop into something.

Saudi Arabian outlet Sport Jazirah have claimed that Cristiano Ronaldo's Al-Nassr are close to signing Casemiro from United. The report states that negotiations are thought to be at an advanced stage.
The Brazilian has been viewed as one player United could look to sell to raise funds.
The news that you have all been waiting for.

Man United have reportedly made a new and improved bid for Bryan Mbuemo understood to be worth over £60m. Ben Jacobs and Alex Crook have reported the news and have claimed that talks have accelerated in the past few days.
Fenerbahce have reportedly reached out to Manchester United regarding the conditions to sign Jadon Sancho.
Turkish journalist Yagiz Sabuncuoglu has claimed that Jose Mourinho's men have formally enquired about Sancho's availability. It's also said that Mourinho is the driving force behind the deal.
Man United have identified FC Krasnodar's Eduard Spertsyan as a possible signing this summer, according to Tutto Atalanta.
The report in Italy has claimed that Spertsyan is wanted by several European clubs with Ajax, PSG, Atalanta and Brentford all keeping tabs on the situation.
It's reported that Krasnodar value him at €25m.
Marcus Rashford is one of the attacking players that Newcastle are targeting this summer.
Eddie Howe is said to be keen on adding another forward to his arsenal this summer and are running the risk of missing out on Joao Pedro.
Football Insider have reported how a possible loan move for Rashford could be on the cards.
News of United's pursuit of Bryan Mbeumo has taken another twist with news of Brentford's demand on the formalities of the deal.

After being unsuccessful with a £55m bid including add-ons, United are expected to make another offer. However, the Evening Standard have reported that the Bees want the majority of the fee paid upfront rather than it being a payment plan over several years.
A name that continues to be mentioned in United's hunt for a new attacker is Christopher Nkunku.

L'Equipe journalist Loic Tanzi has reported that United have opened initial talks with Chelsea to sign Nkunku, who is under contract until 2029. It's said they contacted the entourage in recent days to discuss a possivle transfer.

headline: Manchester United are running out of time to sell two players who cost them £132.9m
body: One of the biggest criticisms Manchester United have faced in recent years has been their failure to offload players at the right time.
United have been guilty of allowing too many players to run down their contracts in, resulting in them leaving for free.

A prime example was when Jesse Lingard was allowed to walk away from Old Trafford for nothing in June 2022. He excelled on loan at West Ham United in the second half of the 2020/21 campaign, scoring nine goals and registering five assists.
It meant he created a market for himself with just a year remaining on his contract and United had a golden opportunity to sell him.

Instead, he was sold the idea by Ole Gunnar Solskjaer that he would have a key role in 2021/22. In reality, he played just 22 times and made a paltry three Premier League starts before leaving for nothing.

Now United must learn their lesson. Having failed to qualify for next season's Champions League, their fixture list could amount to as few as 40 matches. It means head coach Ruben Amorim will not require as big a squad as he did last term.

As hungry as Amorim and the supporters are for new signings to come through the door, outgoings remain just as important at Old Trafford. It is no secret United need to sell to be able to buy this summer.

Matheus Cunha has already cost £62.5million and United have recently tabled an offer in excess of £60m for Bryan Mbeumo. New recruits are likely to cease after that until a flurry of sales are overseen.
United are prioritising the departures of Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho and Antony and they also want to sell Alejandro Garnacho.
Of that quartet, Sancho's United contract is the closest to expiring. His current deal is up in 2026, meaning time is running out for United to bank a respectable fee for him.

United planned to sell him to Chelsea for a fee in excess of £20m after they signed him on a season-long loan deal last summer with an obligation to make it permanent. However, the Londoners have paid a £5m penalty fee to pull out.

United now need to find an alternative route to sell Sancho this summer, and that is so far proving difficult because of his wage demands. One way or another, however, they need to get him off the books or risk of losing him for nothing.

Casemiro's current deal is also up at the end of next season. Amid their search for a midfielder this summer and a lack of European football next term, the Brazilian is unlikely to play a prominent role.

He was on the outskirts of Amorim's squad at the beginning of this calendar year and only United's run to the Europa League final allowed him to salvage something from what had otherwise been a difficult campaign.
He will turn 34 in February and United need to lower the average of their squad. He was always going to be a short-term option after arriving from Real Madrid in August 2022.
United need to sell him for £15m this summer to avoid a loss under the profit and sustainability (PSR) rules. It remains to be seen if anyone will come in for the Brazilian.
But with his and Sancho's current deals up in a year's time, anything would be better than nothing amid the threat of them both leaving next summer for free.

headline: LUCKHURST: Why the next four weeks are Ruben Amorim's most important at Manchester United
body: We have double-checked and triple-checked the calendar. Manchester United take off for their pre-season tour in exactly four weeks.

Their friendly schedule begins in roughly three-and-a-half weeks with another Scandinavian-set friendly against Leeds United. It is their third in six years against their local adversary on foreign turf. It was only three-and-a-half weeks ago that United's post-season tour ended.

Pre-season medicals will be conducted at Carrington in two weeks. Cameramen and photographers are likely to cover both entrances into United's training complex on July 7 in an effort to spot their personas non grata.

Such is the pettiness of Alejandro Garnacho and Marcus Rashford it would not be a surprise if either were unaccounted for. Jadon Sancho does not have a squad number and might as well have cleared out his locker nearly two years ago.

Rashford, Garnacho and Sancho jeopardise squad harmony. Sancho also derided United with a one-word comment on Rashford's Instagram post in February. "Freedom," Sancho wrote. Sancho has freedom of movement, only Chelsea have paid a fee not to buy him.

Chelsea would rather sign Jamie Gittens, a younger winger who left Manchester City's academy for Borussia Dortmund three years after Sancho. That's how little Chelsea think of Sancho and how far his stock has sunk since he joined United four years ago. And he still will not accept a pay cut.

Ruben Amorim has not met Sancho and he does not need to. Sancho eschewed pre-season training in his first summer at United in 2021 when he was expected up at St Andrew's, so he can stay away from his current teammates.

Amorim could do without the sight of the content-creating "brothers" who undermined United on Sunday, too. Rashford and Garnacho are burning their bridges with United, burnt from remunerating Rashford with a five-year contract two years ago.

Rashford is now fluttering his eyelashes at Barcelona. This is a forward on £325,000 a week who has scraped 13 Premier League goals in two seasons and hardly set the world alight in the claret and blue of Aston Villa.

It is a bit like that interaction between Danny Rose and Daniel Levy in the Tottenham Hotspur All or Nothing documentary. Rose was available for a loan move and there was interest from Newcastle United and Bournemouth. Rose wanted something more glamorous.
"Did you follow up on Milan?" he asks. Levy just about suppresses a cackle. "Milan's a no at the moment." Barcelona could be a no for Rashford.
It is fanciful for United to be rid of Rashford, Sancho and Garnacho by the time of take-off at Manchester Airport on July 22. None should be on the plane, though.

There is no resale value to protect with Sancho and Rashford was exiled six months ago. Garnacho, 21 next week, is different but his relationship with Amorim is strained and the manager visibly chuckled at the remote possibility of Garnacho somehow staying at United next season.

Amorim is not the kind of personality to countenance such an arrangement. It was different with Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, saddled with the wantaway Romelu Lukaku in 2019 as United toured Australia, Singapore and China.

Solskjaer repeatedly claimed Lukaku was injured. We had to take him at face value but did not really believe him. Lukaku treated his final trip with United so frivolously he recorded Luke Shaw lagging behind one of the fitness coaches during a jog around the WACA in Perth.
After United returned to Manchester, there were two more friendlies in Norway and Cardiff that Lukaku was absent for. Then he went AWOL.
He finally joined Inter Milan - United's opponents in Singapore - at the end of the Premier League transfer window, back when it closed before the start of the new season.

Lukaku had become such an upstart he leaked data from United's running drills onto Twitter. United, adamant they would not sell for less than the £75m they paid for Lukaku two years earlier, compromised and cut their losses.

Matheus Cunha will be on the plane to the Windy City and United hope Bryan Mbeumo will be. They may have to wait a little longer for that elusive striker, which raises the question as to who would lead the line in a pre-season summer devoid of an international tournament.

Joshua Zirkzee has won over many but Amorim does not consider him a specialist striker. High-ranking figures at United speak dismissively of Rasmus Hojlund, generating interest from Inter Milan. Chido Obi is primed to remain in the first team squad but is far too raw.

In my interview with Matthijs de Ligt last month, he expressed approval of Amorim's methods. "I think what I'm experiencing now is what I like to see and that is what the manager is doing right now. I'm not speaking into details, but I have a feeling he's really looking at the spots.
"I'm not only speaking about players only, but also about the whole culture and the way we are working at the club. I think he's really into details."
We had the ill-fated 'cultural reset' in that summer of 2019. David de Gea told me that "the culture had to change". A check of the calendar confirms that De Gea said that in 2022.
It needs to change again.

headline: Gary Neville has already praised new Manchester United transfer strategy amid £60million decision
body: Manchester United have stepped up their attempts to sign Bryan Mbeumo by tabling a new and improved bid for the Brentford attacker.
United saw an opening offer worth £55m rejected for the 25-year-old earlier this month. They offered £45m up front and an additional £10m in add-ons.
Mbeumo was one of the best players in the Premier League last season, highlighted by his tally of 20 Premier League goals. He also registered seven assists.

United are desperate to strengthen their attacking options this summer after finishing the 2024/25 campaign with a negative goal difference of -10. They have already made progress on that score, signing Matheus Cunha from Wolves for £62.5m earlier this month.

Just as they so often did during Sir Alex Ferguson's heyday, United are now prioritising trying to recruit Premier League proven players, who they hope will be able to come in and hit the ground running.

Their decision to increase their offer for Mbeumo to north of £60m highlights their level of ambition to get another established Premier League operator through the door. Between them, Cunha and Mbeumo scored 35 Premier League goals last season.

Having often turned to the overseas market for new additions in recent years, United's decision to try and recruit players from closer to home is a wise move - and has already had the seal of approval from former Reds captain Gary Neville.
"Man United has become a very difficult place for new signings to operate over the past 10 years," Neville said earlier this month.

"Cunha and [Bryan] Mbeumo have Premier League experience, and are the right type. When I watch wide players these days, they have to be able to get box to box quickly, they have to be able to run and travel with the ball - they can both do that."

With confirmation of United making an improved bid for Mbeumo, it is crystal clear they are prioritising players with Premier League pedigree. As a result, it should allow new additions to adapt to their new surroundings fairly seamlessly.
United have taken too many gambles when it has to come signing attacking players in recent years such as Rasmus Hojlund, Joshua Zirkzee and Antony.
Although Cunha and potentially Mbeumo offer no guarantee of replicating the form they produced at Wolves and Brentford, respectively, United's decision to target the pair of them does make sense.

headline: Alejandro Garnacho Man United transfer latest after Argentina 'request' and shirt controversy
body: Alejandro Garnacho has been a name that has made headlines in recent weeks with uncertainy surrounding his future at Manchester United.
With the summer transfer window not set to close until September 1, Garnacho's future may not be resolved for several weeks.
With that said, MEN Sport has taken a look at the latest surrounding Garnacho.

According to The Mirror, Garnacho has told his teammates at United that Argentina have said they would prefer him to join a 'stronger league' amid links to Saudi Arabia, ahead of next year's World Cup in the United States of America, Canada and Mexico.
Although he has had lucrative offers from Saudi Arabia, it's said the 20-year-old does not want to jeopardise his chances of being part of Argentina's World Cup squad.
Argentina reportedly want him to secure a move to another Premier League club, or even Spain or Italy.
Over the weekend, Garnacho posted a series of pictures from his holiday in Ibiza. One of them was donning an Aston Villa shirt with 'Rashford 9' on the back.
Both players are expted to leave Old Trafford this summer, with Marcus Rashford also not in Amorim's plans. The Argentinian's post on social media caused quite a stir with the United faithful.

Serie A champions Napoli approached the Reds to sign Garnacho back in January but their £40m offer was not enough to tempt United into a sale. With Napoli back in the Champions League next season and Antonio Conte clearly a fan of the youngster, another approach is not out of the question.

Meanwhile, The Independent have also claimed that Villa are monitoring the winger's situation at M16 but his steep asking price could prove to be a stumbling block. Should Morgan Rogers depart amid interest from Arsenal and Chelsea, then Villa could possibly make a move.
A return to the Spanish side has also been touted as a possible option while Bayer Leverkusen are said to be monitoring his situation.
"That's an area of his game that, if he wants to stay at this Man United team and get Man United competing towards the top, end product is key.

"If we go back to even Foden, when they're all fit it's the end product, the final pass or actually getting a goal. So Garnacho, huge questions, I was a big fan of him last year and thought he was going to kick on but this season, but he's not as of yet."

headline: Man United get 'transfer approval' to complete £51.5m deal and grant Ruben Amorim wish
body: Ruben Amorim's hopes of getting his hands on a new goalkeeper at Manchester United this summer have escalated in the past week with a number of names linked with replacing Andre Onana.

High-profile errors at the wrong time has led to Amorim having doubts over the Cameroon international's future at the club. Back-up goalkeeper Altay Bayindir has also struggled to stake a claim with his performance in the 4-1 drubbing at Newcastle United last season hardly convincing.

United's priority in adding attacking reinforcements in the early stages of the transfer window have placed their pursuit of a new goalkeeper on ice. It, however, hasn't stopped goalkeeper transfer speculation with Aston Villa's Emi Martinez understood to be open to a move to Manchester.

Real Madrid goalkeeper Andriy Lunin and highly-rated Atalanta shot-stopper Marco Carnesecchi have also been mentioned as possible candidates to replace Onana. One name that has been supposedly on United's radar for a number of years is Porto's Diogo Costa.

The 25-year-old has been a busy man this summer with him playing a key role in Portugal's Nations League win at the start of the month before featuring twice in Porto's Club World Cup campaign. However, the Dragons crashed out of the competition on Tuesday morning after failing to beat Egyptian side Al Ahly.

Porto's exit has been compounded with reports in Portugal in the aftermath suggesting that Costa 'believes it is time to embrace a new challenge' after achieving all he can with the club. A Bola have claimed the goalkeeper wants to move to a bigger league with United and Manchester City two teams described as being 'very interested'.

Pep Guardiola has already confirmed that Ederson and Stefan Ortega will remain at the club meaning City aren't likely to pursue a move, leaving the door open for United. However, the Portugal number one won't come cheap.

Costa is understood to have a €75million (£63.9m) release clause but Porto could accept around €60m (£51.1m), a fee which is similar to the one United have paid for Matheus Cunha and are about to pay for Bryan Mbeumo.

That figure could decrease as the window goes on, especially if Costa begins to push for a move. For United, Costa's numbers are appealing. Last season, he conceded 27 goals compared to Onana's 44 and boasted a better save percentage (74.1%) in comparison to Onana's 68.9%, despite facing 47 less shots on target.

On the ball, Costa also outshines the current number one. The Porto goalkeeper completed 83.1% of his 1222 passes last term compared to Onana's 72.6%. While the pair are very similar in their numbers for short and medium passes (99.5% in both for Costa and 99.1% for Onana), the Portuguese completed 55.7% of his long passes with Onana managing just 36.6%.

All the numbers point towards United drastically improving in the goalkeeper department with Costa inbetween the sticks. But they would have to sell Onana and seek as close to the £47.2m they paid for him.

headline: Jesse Lingard fires Paul Pogba six-word message as ex-Man United star gives transfer update
body: Jesse Lingard has fired Paul Pogba a message ahead of a proposed return to professional football. The former Manchester United midfielder was provisionally suspended in September 2023 after a random drug test found increased levels of testosterone in his system.

Pogba was then given a four-year ban in February 2024. The France international appealed the decision to the Court of Arbitration for Sport, and his sanction was reduced to 18 months, making him eligible to return to first-team training in January.

Before the 32-year-old could lace up his boots and play competitively again, Juventus terminated his contract, which wasn't set to expire until June 2026. Pogba has been a free agent ever since then, but he appears to have finally found himself a new club.

According to ESPN and Le Parisien, the Frenchman will join AS Monaco this summer. The report adds that Pogba has verbally agreed to sign a two-year contract with the Ligue 1 outfit after turning down a lucrative offer from an unnamed team in the Saudi Pro League.

Pogba teased his return to action on social media earlier this week. On Monday, he uploaded a handful of pictures from a private training session with Amir Richardson, a midfielder for Fiorentina, and Tyreek Hill, a wide receiver for the Miami Dolphins, among others, too.

"I think it's time," wrote Pogba under the post, which has since eclipsed 1.3million likes. Among the thousands of comments from supporters, Jesse Lingard fuelled speculation of a move to Monaco and said: "Hurry up, we ready my bro."

While Pogba has been linked with a return to football, he's remained coy on the matter, at least publicly. Speaking on Sergio Aguero's podcast, La Casa del Kun, the former United star provided an update on his future.

"I haven't signed anything, but there's interest. We'll see," said Pogba. "In life, you never know. I loved the people who went to see Boca's match [at the Club World Cup], it's crazy because I went to Marseille, which is hot, Naples is hot, but Boca... I've never seen that in my life."
Then, in an interview with French television channel TF1, Pogba opened up about how he was treated by Juventus before being released. He said: "I asked Juventus for help, but I wasn't given it.
"I asked to get a fitness coach. I had the right, and I was always part of the team. They weren't very kind to me, and they did not support me, and I was shocked. I did not understand why.

"I thought I was at war with anti-doping authorities, not Juventus. I couldn't keep taking my kids to school every day, passing by the stadium and the training centre, and knowing I wouldn't be able to play for a long time.
"My kids kept asking me when I'd be back on the pitch and when they could watch me at the stadium again."
Pogba added: "I'm mentally and physically ready, and I'm eager to start again. I'm 32, but I still feel like a young kid."

headline: Paul Pogba denied Mason Greenwood Man United reunion with transfer 'close'
body: Former Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba looks set to miss out on the chance of reuniting with Mason Greenwood at Marseille with the 32-year-old closing in on a return to football.
Pogba is now eligible to return to professional football following the conclusion of his ban. The former United star tested positive for the banned substance DHEA and was later released by Juventus.
The Frenchman has been linked with a host of teams, including a shock second return to Old Trafford, but a move to Ligue 1 side AS Monaco appears to be close to being completed.

Previously, a move to Marseille had been mooted with the opportunity to link-up with former United teammate Greenwood. However, it's understood that Roberto De Zerbi's team have not made an official proposal for Pogba due to a number of reasons.

Marseille already have a large pool of midfield options with Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg's loan move being made permanent and Ismael Bennacer set to follow him. Geoffrey Kondogbia, Adrien Rabiot, Valentin Rongier and Bilal Nadir all make up De Zerbi's midfield options.

And according to French outlet RMC Sport, Marseille's other concern surrounded Pogba's fitness. It's said that they were not convinced that the midfielder would be in the shape necessary to play and be successful.

A move to Monaco, which hasn't yet been made official, will see Pogba compete in France for the first time in his career. The 32-year-old previously represented Le Havre at youth level before moving to England in 2009.

It does also mean that he won't add to the 71 games played with Greenwood during their time at Old Trafford. The attacker moved to France last summer after United decided he had no future at the club.

headline: Roy Keane verdict on Alejandro Garnacho speaks volumes amid Man United controversy
body: Alejandro Garnacho’s time at Manchester United seems limited, with the Argentine joining Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho, and Antony on the club’s list of priority sales.

It hasn't been an easy journey for the Argentine youngster since arriving at Old Trafford from Atletico Madrid in 2020. Initially featuring for the academy, Garnacho broke into the senior squad during United's 3-0 win over Moldovan team Sheriff Tiraspol in the 2022 UEFA Europa League, starting alongside Cristiano Ronaldo.

He has now become embroiled in fresh controversy, however, after sharing a photo of himself on social media which shows him wearing an Aston Villa shirt bearing Rashford's name and number on the back.

Over the years, Garnacho has come under fire for his behaviour both on and off the pitch. Reds legend Roy Keane hasn’t held back in his criticism on multiple occasions, and here, MEN Sport takes a look at some of his comments.
Keane believes Garnacho cannot be trusted to start for United, suggesting he performs better as a substitute off the bench.

Speaking to ITV during United's FA Cup tie against Leicester City in February, he said: "I think it suits Garnacho when he comes off the bench. I don’t think you can trust him when he starts. But when he comes off the bench and you’re gambling and the team is stretched, that’s when he comes into his own.
"United put Leicester on the backfoot and the subs came on. That’s what Garnacho does well. The first half United were going sideways and sideways. He came on and tested Leicester."
Before United’s Manchester derby against Manchester City, Keane shared his thoughts on what the Argentine winger needed to improve in his game.

"That's an area of his game that, if he wants to stay at this Man United team and get Man United competing towards the top, end product is key. If we go back to even Foden, when they're all fit it's the end product, the final pass or actually getting a goal.
"So Garnacho, huge questions, I was a big fan of him last year and thought he was going to kick on but this season, but he's not as of yet."

After scoring in United’s 3-0 win over Leicester City last November, Keane criticized the Argentine’s muted celebration. The former midfielder argued that players should show respect to fans who travel to watch them play, adding that he should leave the club if he can’t even celebrate with them.

"If you can’t celebrate a goal, there is something drastically wrong with this game," the former Reds captain Keane said on the Stick to Football podcast. "Whatever has gone on off the pitch for any player - it could be family stuff - you work all week, you’re playing the game to score a goal.

"When you score a goal, there should be nothing else on your mind. You’ve got fans who have travelled, paid fortunes to get there, and he’s [Garnacho] on about people having a go at him. People make sacrifices to travel to watch Manchester United, he scores a brilliant goal, they are having a tough time - and if a younger player can’t enjoy scoring a goal for Man United, then get a job somewhere else."
Keane singled out Garnacho for criticism following the 1-0 defeat to Chelsea last month. "Garnacho is immature," he stated.

"He plays in little moments, but he doesn't do enough. We spoke before the programme - you want players for the big clubs that turn up week in, week out. He doesn't do that. He's got a bit of talent; he makes some good runs and threatens in behind. On his good day, you think, 'I like what I see.' But he's got too many bad days."

headline: Man United learn Viktor Gyokeres transfer 'timeline' as fresh Arsenal update emerges
body: Viktor Gyokeres' future remains unresolved, with Manchester United still linked to the prolific goalscorer.

The Sweden international remains linked with a move away from Sporting Clube de Portugal, with Arsenal and Juventus among the clubs vying for his signature. Unlike United, Arsenal can offer Champions League football - something that appeals to the 27-year-old.
Despite talks of a reunion with Ruben Amorim at Old Trafford, Gyokeres seems inclined to join Arsenal - but whether the move will materialise remains to be seen
With that said, MEN Sport has taken a look at the latest surrounding Gyokeres.

According to Portuguese newspaper Record, the club’s decision left Gyokeres 'angered'. In response, the striker removed all references to Sporting and Sweden from his Instagram bio, which now simply reads 'Sportsperson'.

Addressing the situation, Sporting president Frederico Varandas said: "One thing is that you should already know me better. Threats, blackmail and insults don't work with me. I can guarantee that Viktor Gyokeres will not leave for €60+€10m (in add-ons) because I never promised him that."

When asked if there were any offers for €60m, Varandas added: "To this day, Sporting has not had an offer for Viktor Gyokeres, neither today nor last season. He is a fantastic professional, to this day he has had zero offers. He has a three-year contract with Sporting."
Portuguese newspaper A Bola now claims that Gyokeres is growing frustrated with the lack of progress on his transfer.
Both United and Arsenal have long been known to admire the prolific striker, while Atletico Madrid, Juventus and Saudi Pro League side Al Ahli are among the other potential suitors.
talkSPORT reporter Alex Crook revealed he received a message claiming the Swede has told family and friends he expects to join Arsenal.
"I had a message 24 hours or so ago suggesting that Viktor Gyokeres has told friends and family he expects to join Arsenal," he is quoted as saying.
According to Portuguese newspaper Correio da Manha, Mikel Arteta wants Gyokeres in place for Arsenal’s pre-season tour of Asia at the end of next mont
Meanwhile, different Portuguese newspaper Record claimed last week that Gyokeres is set to 'wait until the end to see his dream of playing for Arsenal become reality.'
The Sweden international is still on holiday but believes patience will be crucial to securing a move to north London this summer.

headline: Alejandro Garnacho may never fulfil Man United wish amid Aston Villa shirt controversy
body: Alejandro Garnacho continues to make headlines amid his much-talked-about future at Manchester United.
Garnacho's stock at Old Trafford has risen and fallen just as quickly over the last few years.
After helping the club pick up yet another FA Youth Cup, in 2022, the Madrid-born Argentina forward was thrust into the first-team and quickly billed as the next big hope in times of turmoil.

However, after showing his support for Marcus Rashford with a controversial post on social media - with the Argentine spotted wearing an Aston Villa shirt with 'Rashford 9' printed on the back - he may never pull on the shirt he really wanted all along.
During his first steps in professional football, Garnacho wore No.75 for United - with quick-fire upgrades to No.49 and No.17 coming in consecutive seasons.
All the while, he was being considered for the most iconic shirt of them all at Old Trafford - the No.7 worn by countless greats from years-gone-by.
Included in that esteemed list is, of course, Garnacho's footballing idol - Cristiano Ronaldo - who wore No.7 in his two spells with the Premier League giants.
However, while that topic was discussed internally two years ago, the decision was made to make then-new signing Mason Mount the club's next No.7 post-Ronaldo.
Garnacho's time, it was thought, was to come. Now, 24 months on, his time at United could be up, putting a clear end to one of his biggest targets.

headline: Eight Manchester United players on transfer notice ahead of Arsenal opening game
body: Manchester United are expected to be busy in the summer transfer market - both in terms of incomings and outgoings.
Ruben Amorim's side now know they will kick off their Premier League campaign at home to Arsenal but the squad as it is now will look very different come August 17.
United will hope to blood some new signings against the Gunners but there will be a number of departures this summer, too.
With that in mind, here is a look at eight United players who are on transfer notice ahead of that first game of the season.
Manchester United have launched their new home kit for the 2025/26 season with an Adidas shirt paying tribute to Old Trafford.
Fans can order their Men's, Women's and Kid's shirt today.
United are expected to make at least one change to the goalkeeping department but the question is whether it is their first or second choice goalkeeper who leaves this summer.
Tom Heaton will certainly remain as third choice goalkeeper after agreeing to a new contract but there are two different scenarios that could play out this summer.

The first is that Andre Onana leaves the club amid interest from Monaco and the Saudi Pro League. His departure would see United sign a new number one goalkeeper, with Aston Villa star Emi Martinez being linked with a move to the club.
The other scenario is that Onana stays and United sign a new second choice goalkeeper to offer him stronger competition. That would then see Turkish international Altay Bayindir leave the club.
Malacia was shipped off on loan to PSV in January but didn't do enough in that spell to convince the Dutch champions to make the move permanent.
The Dutch international missed a huge chunk of time with a knee injury before that and has been deemed surplus to requirements at Old Trafford.
The Brazil international actually ended the season as one of United's best performers but that shouldn't cloud a decision when it comes to his future.
Casemiro is 33 and has one year remaining on his contract. This summer represents the last chance to get a significant fee for the former Real Madrid star and it is a chance they cannot pass up.
Garnacho has been told he can leave United this summer by Amorim amid the fallout from the Argentina international not starting the Europa League final.
Napoli and Chelsea are among the clubs interested in the 20-year-old who still has three years remaining on his contract with the club. He should bank United a sizeable transfer fee.
So, too, should Rashford who is available for transfer after Amorim decided he was no longer part of his plans at the end of last year.
After a positive loan spell with Aston Villa, Barcelona seems the most probable destination for the England international this summer.
United are confident they can bank a fee for Antony, too, after he rejuvenated his career on loan at Real Betis.

The Brazil international's confidence had hit rock bottom at Old Trafford but nine goals and five assists in half a season in Seville, helping Betis reach the UEFA Conference League final, has seen him rediscover his form.
Betis and Atletico Madrid have been linked with a permanent move.
Chelsea opted against making Sancho's loan deal a permanent stay but the England international's future still lies away from Old Trafford.
Sancho's contract expires next summer and it will be a clean break for all parties if he can find a new permanent home this summer.
The pair scored just seven Premier League goals between them last summer and United need an upgrade.
Should one arrive then the expectation would be one of Hojlund or Zirkzee would leave the club, with plenty of interest from Serie A clubs in both of them.

headline: Man United can take a lot from £17m snub and fan bust-up as swap deal opportunity emerges
body: A potential swap deal involving Manchester United winger Jadon Sancho and Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic could be on the horizon.

Sancho, who spent last season on loan at Chelsea, where he clinched the UEFA Conference League, is expected to be sold this summer. His last appearance for the Red Devils was in the Community Shield last year, marking a disappointing stint for both player and club.

One possibility being mooted is a move to Juventus in exchange for the Serbian striker. The 25-year-old, previously linked with Arsenal, has been largely confined to the bench at the Italian giants following the loan signing of Randal Kolo-Muani in January.

Italian media reports suggest that Juventus are considering offering Vlahovic - who has a year left on his contract - to secure Sancho, whom they have been interested in since last year, according to La Gazzetta dello Sport.
Despite boasting a respectable tally of 57 goals in 144 games, Vlahovic has struggled to replicate the lethal form he displayed during his time at Fiorentina, reports the Mirror.

This season, he has scored 16 goals across all competitions, just one less than Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee combined. This scoring prowess will undoubtedly be attractive to the Premier League giants.

Regarding his uncertain future, the Serbian striker reportedly turned down an eye-watering £17million-a-year deal back in January, according to Corriere dello Sport. Despite not yet reaching his peak, Vlahovic's decision to stay in a top European league rather than accepting a lucrative offer from Saudi Pro League side Al-Nassr could be seen as a positive sign by United bosses.
It shows that he has ambitions to compete for trophies on the top stage rather than take a big payday.

Vlahovic's commitment to his club and team-mates, meanwhile, was evident last season during a challenging period for Juventus. After a fourth consecutive Serie A draw, which ended 2-2 against Venezia, the Juve players walked over to their fans to thank them for their support, as is tradition.

However, the fans responded with insults and disrespectful chants. Vlahovic didn't take kindly to this and shouted back at the fans. Despite the players walking away, the fans continued with their insults, prompting the striker to give them a sarcastic thumbs-up, as reported by Sky Sport Italia.

While it's not ideal for a player to have a row with their own supporters, it does demonstrate to United that Vlahovic isn't shy about expressing his views and will back his team-mates when he deems it necessary.

Introducing such a robust character into the dressing room could yield both positive and negative outcomes, and Ruben Amorim will undoubtedly be weighing up a variety of factors as he continues his quest for additional reinforcements this summer, including a new striker.

The Portuguese boss has so far welcomed one new signing this summer in Matheus Cunha, who they purchased for £62.5m from Wolves. While interest persists in Bryan Mbeumo and Viktor Gyokeres, United are facing competition for the attackers from Tottenham Hotspur and Arsenal, respectively.

headline: Liam Delap explains why he sealed Chelsea transfer after Manchester United snub
body: Chelsea striker Liam Delap has said the Londoners' project was what convinced him to seal a £30million move to Stamford Bridge earlier this month.
The England Under-21 international had established himself as United's top target in their search for a striker this summer after scoring a respectable 12 goals in his debut season at Ipswich Town.
Delap became available via a £30m release clause that was triggered following Ipswich's immediate relegation back to the Championship. He joined the Tractor Boys from Manchester City as last July.
The 22-year-old was a shining light in a difficult season for the Suffolk club, meaning his return of 12 Premier League goals for a relegated club was deemed a very respectable tally.

United are desperate to recruit a striker this summer and Delap held talks with them about a move to Old Trafford. However, the former Hull City loanee, who also held talks with Everton and Newcastle United, settled on a move to Chelsea.
"It was a nice position to be in, but also there are a lot of decisions you have to make," Delap told the Athletic. "You never know if it is going to be the right decision.
"You've just got to go with your gut and hopefully it works out. There are so many factors that go into it.
"I’ve got a good relationship with the manager. I know how he plays. I've played in this system before.
"I know a lot of the players here and the project of the club, how they see the future. That's what excited me."

As a result of missing out on Delap, United are yet to identify their preferred alternative target in their search for a No.9. They continue to be linked with a plethora of options, including Viktor Gyokeres of Sporting Lisbon, Napoli ace Victor Osimhen and Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike.

headline: Transfer interest confirmed in forgotten Man United midfielder amid looming contract decision
body: Rotherham United manager Matt Hamshaw has confirmed he is interested in re-signing Manchester United midfielder Dan Gore in this summer's transfer window.

Gore joined the League One side on loan back in January for the second half of the 2024/25, but his temporary stint in South Yorkshire was ravaged by a foot injury, restricting him to just three appearances.

The youngster, who is out of contract at Old Trafford next summer, reported a problem with his foot on the morning of a clash with Shrewsbury Town in early-February, prompting former Millers boss Steve Evans to question how he had sustained the injury.

However, Gore did not play again until the penultimate weekend of the season. He returned to Carrington for treatment and a rehabilitation programme, during which time Evans was sacked and replaced by Hamshaw.

With the 20-year-old facing an uncertain future in M16 ahead of the forthcoming campaign, Millers chief Hamshaw has admitted he would like to bring him back to the New York Stadium for a second spell, but accepts there will be interest from elsewhere.

"I know there is competition for him because he is highly rated at Manchester United and has been in and around their first team," Hamshaw told the Rotherham Advertiser. "I also know that their manager likes him.

"I'm well aware there will probably be other interest. There is a foreign market open now to Manchester United and English players and we will probably have a bit of competition but if we could get him it would be amazing.
"Any deal has to be right for the club. We won't go out of our means to do something but at the same time if I can get him then I know the chairman will back me on that one.
"I'm a big admirer of Dan. If I can get mhim, great. If I can't then I can't."

Gore, who made his competitive debut for United against Crystal Palace in the Carabao Cup in September 2023, is highly-rated by the Reds and the club acknowledges he has experienced some desperately bad luck on the injury front in the last 18 months.
His loan spell at Port Vale in the second half of the 2023/24 season saw him get injured on his debut and he did not play for the club again.

headline: Arsenal ‘ask’ to sign Man Utd star in shock transfer with ‘offer made’ amid new ‘agreement’
body: According to reports, Arsenal have plotted a shock move to sign a Manchester United star as they have ‘asked’ whether a move would be possible.
The Gunners are in the market for several key additions after enduring a sub-par season in 2024/25, finishing second in the Premier League for a third consecutive season and missing out on a trophy.
It is common knowledge that their top priority is to sign a new striker, with Sporting Lisbon’s Viktor Gyokeres and RB Leipzig’s Benjamin Sesko named as their leading targets.
Arsenal are reportedly set to make a huge offer for their apparent top striker target, while they are also pursuing targets in other positions.
A fresh report has claimed that their first two signings are expected to be a goalkeeper and a centre-midfielder, while they are also looking for a new winger.
READ: Eze to Spurs, Rogers to Arsenal as Champions League hoovers up talent
The Gunners have been linked with several potential options, with Real Madrid’s Rodrygo Goes and Athletic Bilbao’s Nico Williams named as targets.
However, a new report claims Arsenal have surprisingly looked at Man Utd for a solution, as Caught Offside are reporting that they have ‘enquired’ about Jadon Sancho.
The England international is set to leave Man Utd this summer as he is not part of Ruben Amorim’s plans after spending the 2024/25 campaign on loan at Chelsea.
The Blues opted against signing Sancho permanently, paying a reported £5m penalty fee to Man Utd to opt out of an obligation to buy clause.

MORE ARSENAL COVERAGE ON F365…
👉 Arsenal ‘dream’ signing given timeframe as Real Madrid ‘set’ demand for ‘most likely’ transfer
👉 Chelsea transfer to be ‘done imminently’ despite Arsenal hijack attempt with ‘agreement in place’
👉 Ten possible Arsenal replacements for Thomas Partey includes PL pair and Lewis-Skelly
Chelsea’s verdict on Sancho leaves his long-term future unclear, but Caught Offside say Arsenal have ‘asked’ about signing him.
After making this request, it is also noted that they have not ‘followed it up’ and a move to Turkish giants Fenerbahce is more likely for Sancho at this point.
The report claims Fenerbahce have ‘made an offer’ for Sancho. It is also noted that he is ‘wanted’ by Jose Mourinho, who has ‘spoken’ to the winger.
‘Fenerbahce have offered a tempting contract with high wages to Sancho, who is seriously considering it. There’s no final decision yet, but it’s currently Sancho’s best offer.
‘Napoli and Dortmund have also made offers to Sancho, while Arsenal made an enquiry but haven’t followed it up.’
A report in Turkey has gone further, claiming Sancho has already ‘said yes’ to Fenerbahce and ‘accepted their salary offer’ worth ten million euros with an ‘agreement’ reached.
‘It was learned that the star player said ‘Yes’ to a salary of approximately 10 million Euros. Thereupon, Fenerbahçe started preparing its offer.

‘It is expected that the negotiations with Man Utd will start and the transfer will be concluded positively. The fact that the English team wants to send the player due to his high salary of 12 million Euros strengthens Fenerbahce’s hand.’
According to reports, one Manchester United star is on the brink of leaving the Premier League side as he has ‘said yes’ to a move to a European giant.
Man Utd have spent a mere £1.7bn since Sir Alex Ferguson retired at the end of 2012/13. That’s a lot of wonga for zero Premier League titles…
According to reports, Manchester United are in ‘direct contact’ over a swap deal ‘solution’ with Serie A giants Juventus regarding Jadon Sancho.
A Manchester United transfer reportedly hinges on one condition, while a Red Devils star has been pictured wearing the shirt of a rival Premier League club.
A Liverpool fan does not think the Reds are firm favourites for the Premier League title due to four concerns, with Florian Wirtz the ‘new Kai Havertz’.
Juventus have joined Serie A champions Napoli in the race to bring in a Premier League winger in the summer transfer window.
